intro: Hibbertia subglabra, commonly known as the smooth hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Dilleniaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with red markings. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in regions such as New South Wales and Queensland. Hibbertia subglabra has smooth, glabrous stems and leaves that are often elliptical in shape. It is a hardy species that thrives in full sun and is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance.
